metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11727 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability exists where it possible to force Network Security Services (NSS) to sign CertificateVerify with PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures when those are the only ones advertised by server in CertificateRequest in TLS 1.3. PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures should not be used for TLS 1.3 messages. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only an issue with TLSv1.3. Releases before Bionic have no TLSv1.3 support. Bionic shipped with an incompatible TLSv1.3 draft, so likely not used.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
